Description: Eyes that are capable of blinking and turning eyeballs.
Allows for natural simulation of eyebrow movements (i.e. change shape, go up and down, side to side)
The jaw not only moves up and down, but all is able to curve to allow for natural jaw movement
Laughing control that the user can use to allow the costume character to laugh; removes the need for the user to actually laugh; enables more authentic laughing
User wears an earphone because noise in the congested head makes it difficult to hear; an inconspcuous mic is attached on the costume body to capture sounds from the outside and send to the earphone
Smart phone camera is used to recognize users' facial movements and use the data to control the face's expressions mechanisms.  Similar to Snapchat's facial recognition.
Pillow tucked inside the fur allows costume to be soft and comfortable to hug.
When a character is giving a hug, the body will emit heat with the use of heat patches tucked under the fur.  Great for places with cold weather.
Like the Google Glass, these smart glasses will be able to recognize eye and eyebrow movement.
The user will wear stickers around the eyebrow, eyes and mouth and a facial recognition interface can pick up the movements
This box will enable international visitors at theme park to converse with talking characters.  The performoer can speak using English but the voice will come out a different language.
Head piece worn on the costume head will contain a cooling fan inside.
Heat from inside the costume will travel out to the person interacting with the character, creates a warm happy sensation.
When a character is surprised or scared, the pupils will go small using LCD.
The wearer will use the voice to control the characters' facial expresisons
For costumes that require fake arms, the user can move them using a voice activated controller
Use a soft, plush like material or rubber to make the face stretchy anf flexible.
When the performer gets too hot, he or she can push a botton that will alert an attendant that he wishes to go backstage.
Kind of like UNIQLO Heat Tech, this kind of clothing keeps the body cool.
Using a water heat exchanger, a helmet that can be worn is filled with cool water to keep the head cool.
the eyes of the character are actually LED screens displaying an eye, moving around and blinking
a water reserve placed in an isothermic container on the back of the performer. A small pipr near his mouth allows him to sip water easily wile in the suit
Allowing the neck of the suit to move indepedently from the rest of the suit by detaching it from the body (rolling ball bearing)
small loudspeakers located at the beginning of the character's mouth/throat, so as to make it speak in a lively manner
small fans in the hear gear, with a small "ice pack" to locally cool the air and blow the cooler air
all the head actuators can actually be detached from the suit and fold themselves in a backpack the performer is wearing
small red LED behind cheeks, so that the character can actually blush. There are some sensors of the cheeks to actually detect a kiss from a guest
the suit has thermal probes that can be applied on the performer's body to check his body temperature. a small red light goes on if it's becoming dangerous
An exo-squeletton like dispositive to help the performer move the suit around, compensating for its weight. It mainly helps arms and leg movement
a light structure around the performer's limbs, so that the suit is not directly in contact with the performer's skin, to thus make the suit less hot
The two eyebrows are connected by a pair number of gears. One of them is actuated by a servomotor. thus both eyebrows will move at the same time
Both eyebrows are connected together, and a string links the ensemble to a servomotor at the back of the head, allowing the ensemble the move up and down all at once

The frame of the suit is made with a rigid plastic that  keeps the form of the character's belly, a fat one, allowing the character to look fat from the outside without having to fill the suit with foam.
A little light is placed by the performer's eyes, turning red when the battery of the actuators is low and the suit needs to be recharged

a button on the waist of the performer, that can be pulleb from the outside of the suit. the button is connected to the character attendant, and when pressed it alerts him that the performer is not feeling right and needs to go backstage to take off the suit
An electrical plug dissimulated in the fur, allowing the suit to be recharged without having to remove the fur.

flat shoes with a snickers-like structure, to improve the comfort of the performer. The surrounding/exterior aspect of the shoe is, however, shaped according to the character. Thus, for example, a performerin a female character's suit won't actually have to wear high heels

a series of microphones placed into the nose of the character and in its ears to catch the surrounding conversations. The conversations are transmitted to earphones so that the performer can actually hear the guests talking to him

a sensor placed on the nose or the forehead of the character, detecting the luminosity of the surroundings to adjust the image the performer is seeing, providing him the best image possible in any circumstance/venue

A small camera placed inside the suit, and directed towards the performer's lips. The camera analyses the lip motion of the performer and litteraly reads it, before providing the information to an exterior loudspeaker reproducing the voice of the character.
A device that we can wear on neck using Peltier effect: let electricity through and transfer the heat from one material to another
Use thin-clothes covered borescopeon the eyes of character as camera
Have ice bags in the costume frameto absorb heat from person inside
Use the data from snapchat as input to control facial expressionof costume
Use hexagon structure as frameof costume to decrease weightand increase air fluency
Connect camera to VR mediaheadset to provide better vision
Have pipes with cooling fluid surround user_s wrist and ankle toabsorb heat
Have pre-defined facial expressionsets and switch by controller
Use phone and magnifier to transfer user_s voice to guest
Use light reflection signal to computegazing point of eyes and output movement of eyes
Have wheels with spring-switch on the foot of costume
Medicine dropper to cool user down
Have bubble film under costume's skin to avoid injury
use air(Hydrogen) filled bag as character's bully
have fan and mist hidden in mouth of character in order to fresh the air
belt shaped circular plastic frame that surrounds the bully of character, distributing load on the wrist of perfrmer
extending from the belt frame. form a inner plat form, allow performer to sit on it or put backpack on
have hidden speaker on the field where the character acts and play pre-recorded voice of cahracter
have cheeks as shaped ballons. control amount of air to raise and lower cheek
to be companied with LED eyes. sensoring light strength and tune the lightness of LED screen
Make the character's eyes in a kind of sun glass, allowing the performer to see through them
make the cheeks of the character in silicone or rubber, to make their movement easier andmore credible
Make the eyebrows out of rubber, and at their core place a multi-piece mechanical arm that can make it move in several directions
The lips of the character are made out of rubber, and a linear succession of actuators is places in the "gums" of the character, to make them move.

The corner of the character's mouth is actually sewed on as a continuation of the character's mouth. Behind, actuators are linked to these "corner of the mouth", pulling them up and down to convey the impression that the character is smiling or sad.

The hands of the character are semi-robotic ones, linked to the performer's hands. This is made so as to convert the 5-fingers movements of the performer in the 4-fingers movement of the character. For this, some strings are attached to four of the performer's fingers to move the character's ones

This detection watch is to track the heart rate of the performer and some other physical characters to judge whether the performer is in a good condition or whether he/she should be replaced by other performers

Theme parks can put many big logs along the route the characters take, so the performers wearing big costumes can sit on them to take a rest. And in the log chair, there is a cooling system which can take away heat from the performer.
Make a jaw using plastic plates. It can be connected to the head frame by some springs. The performer put his/her jaw on the plate.When he/she moves his/her own jaw, the character's jaw moves.
Since the costume is very thick, and may hinder the performer hearing the guest clearly. The strong receiver mounted on the ear of the character can make the performer hear outside world clearly.ÿ

There exists a detection scheme mounted in the head of the animatronic character, which can detect the facial expressions of the performer and these data can be used for making the character_s face take on the same animated facial features. For example, the performer in this costume smiles, the character smiles; the performer moves his/her eyes from left to right, the character does the same thing.

The re-designed costume using the mini camera mounted on the forehead of costume head, which is hidden well, just like it is invisible. Compared with traditional costumes, the hidden camera with other devices,  can provide the performer inside the suit with a wider range of vision. Therefore, the operator or the performer is less likely to fall down due to the bad vision.

To make a big belly for the character like a bear, and meanwhile make sure that the costume is not so heavy, we can use the plastic strips to construct a frame and then attach it to the fuzzy clothes.
In the spare room of the costume, the performer can take aÿmini backpack which contains a cooling bag. The materials can be ices or chemical stuffs. Just to take away the heat of performers.
An amplifier hidden behind the tie of the character, which can make the sound of the character louder. And another sound modifier to make the voice like the original one in the cartoon.
Performers wear the scarf to cool the part near the neck. The e-scarf functions as a mini air conditioner.
Use the sun glass (dark but transparent) to make eyes of the character. The performer will see outside through it.
Air tube hidden in the big ear of the character helps the ventilation, providing the fresh air.
There is a sensor in the hand. When the character claps hands or high five with guests, the sensor receives the signal to actuate the ventilation system. Then the performer can breathe well.

When it is overcast, people may feel upset. The performer may lose the passion to take on so many animated features or frequenly interact with guests. While the happy eyeglasses can just make the views the performer sees brighter, like under the sunshine, to make him/her happier and more positive. (The mechanism is like the filter in the camera)
Above the hip, performer wears a wide belt. The belt is made like a trough. Ice bags and some remote controller can be placed here.
The switch on the arm can open the belly of the character. Other workers can replenish some ice bags on the trough belt or just help the performer ventilate temporarily.

There exists a wheel in the shoe, but it cannot be perceived in normal situation. When the performer is tired, he/she can press the shoes hard against the ground to take the wheels out by utilizing the spring. Then the performer feels like wearing a pair of roller skates.
The belt connects the upper body and the lower part. And it is fixed around the hip, so te weight of the costume can be shared by the hip, rather than shoulders alone.
Some air tubes with holes, attached to the "pants" of the character helps ventilation in the lower part of the costume. There shouldÿbe a gap between pants and shoesÿ.
When the character pose some gestures, he/she press the switch of the pump hard, which is mounted on the heel of shoes. The pump suctions some cool air from outside by the pants tube.
The glass can be transparent or not. The performance can see through the glass when they want to, or choose to look at the screen on the glass that shows the surrounding outside of the costume
Sticky pad on the fingers allows the costume to pick up things
A supporting truss system that allows people to sit down
Allows user to communicate with outside
This pads not only cool/warm the performance also cool/warm the guests
Maintain moderate temperature environment inside the costume
Remove heat from the body
An add-on for the costume which can record the number of tourists&interaction made by the guests, so to provide valuable information for future improvement
Capture the facial expression, analyze customers' reaction
Tracks the position of the costume
An speaker and sound converter that convert the human voice to animated voice
Allows the tail to move as the mood/music in the theme park, and provides extra balancing torque to the body frame
Allows the ear to move as the mood of the performers/music in the theme park
Gather the guest information in the park and calculate the most crowded spots, so to allocate the positions of the performers
Utilize rubber/fabric to create wrinkle on the character's face so to make the facial expression more vivid
The belly of the character can be inflated and deflated
The arm can move automatically while the operator is in emergency
When the operator is in emergency, he can press the button and call centralized service
The clothes is removable and washable
Provide real time view at the back of the costume, because sometimes the costume is pretty big which makes the performer hard to see what's in the back
